feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 3:54PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...PERIODS OF RAINFALL WILL CONTINUE ACROSS SOUTHCENTRAL THROUGH AROUND NOONTIME SUNDAY... Deep and moist southwesterly flow will continue through late Saturday afternoon/early Saturday evening. As a result, expect periods of rain to continue. There may be a drier period beginning by Saturday evening as steady rain tapers off into showers, with a

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 12:10PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Rising Water Levels on Rivers Draining the Brooks Range... Several weather fronts moved across the Brooks Range the past couple of days bringing rising water levels to rivers and streams through Saturday. Additional rainfall totals from 0.25 to 0.50 inches are possible through this evening. Water levels are expected to remain within bank and below flood stage. Those taking

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 1:56AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Marshall, south central Jackson and DeKalb Counties through 245 AM CDT... At 155 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Albertville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued August 19 at 10:59AM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A High Surf Advisory remains in effect... * WHAT...Surf of 10 to 13 feet. * WHERE...South and east facing shores of all islands. * WHEN...through tonight. * IMPACTS...Minor. Expect some strong breaking waves, shorebreak, and strong longshore and rip currents making swimming difficult

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 3:12AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED FIRE WEATHER CONCERNS TODAY FOR CONNECTICUT... The potential for fire spread is enhanced. The prolonged absence of wetting rains, along with moderate to severe drought conditions, have led to very dry soil moistures and ground fuels. Any fire that ignites will easily and rapidly spread in these conditions.

entry.summary: ...ELEVATED FIRE WEATHER CONCERNS TODAY FOR MASSACHUSETTS, RHODE ISLAND AND CONNECTICUT... entry.summary: ...AREAS OF DENSE FOG THROUGH THIS MORNING... entry.title: Tropical Storm Warning issued August 19 at 9:58PM CDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...TROPICAL STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT... * LOCATIONS AFFECTED - South Padre Island * WIND - LATEST LOCAL FORECAST: Equivalent Tropical Storm force wind - Peak Wind Forecast: 35-45 mph with gusts to 55 mph

entry.title: Flood Warning issued August 19 at 9:26PM CDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Nueces River Near Three Rivers affecting Live Oak County. For the Nueces River...including Cotulla, Tilden, Three Rivers, Mathis, Bluntzer, Calallen...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE...

entry.title: Flood Warning issued August 19 at 9:23PM CDT until August 24 at 3:49PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Nueces River Near Tilden affecting McMullen County. For the Nueces River...including Cotulla, Tilden, Three Rivers, Mathis, Bluntzer, Calallen...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued August 19 at 8:48PM CDT until August 20 at 7:50PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Rio Grande below Presidio 5SE affecting Presidio County. .Thunderstorms producing heavy rainfall along the Rio Grande and Rio Conchos have brought both rivers into minor flood in places. Rivers are forecast to crest overnight, and slowly recede Saturday. Additional rainfall could exacerbate conditions.

entry.title: Flood Watch issued August 19 at 4:57PM CDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of southwest and south central New Mexico and Far West Texas, including the following counties. In New Mexico, Dona Ana, Otero, Sierra, Luna, Hidalgo, and Grant counties. In Texas,
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern, Central El Paso County; Northern Hudspeth Highlands, Hueco Mountains; Rio Grande Valley of Eastern El Paso, Western Hudspeth Counties; Rio Grande Valley of Eastern Hudspeth County; Salt Basin; Southern Hudspeth Highlands; Western El Paso County
